sentences.sContent: I'd rather have seen him gnash his teeth than smile so.
sentences.sContent_eng: I'd rather have seen him gnash his teeth than smile so.
sentences.sCn: 我宁可看他咬牙也不愿看这样的笑。

sentences.sContent: The wicked plot against the righteous and gnash their teeth at them;
sentences.sContent_eng: The wicked plot against the righteous and gnash their teeth at them;
sentences.sCn: 恶人设谋害义人，又向他咬牙。

sentences.sContent: It makes me gnash my teeth to see so much food deliberately destroyed or wasted when there are people starving in Africa.
sentences.sContent_eng: It makes me gnash my teeth to see so much food deliberately destroyed or wasted when there are people starving in Africa.
sentences.sCn: 当非洲人民在 挨饿时，我看到这么多故意毁坏和浪费的食物，真 使我气得咬牙切齿。

trans.tranOther: to be very angry or unhappy about something, or to move your teeth against each other so that they make a noise, especially because you are unhappy or angry
